text: = Here is how the same process plays out in a modern web application. v The user makes a request to view a certain page. v The controller receives this request and gives a specific set of orders that are pertinent for the route in question (e.g., for the view to update or serve a certain page, or for the model to perform specific logic). v If the request has some logic associated with it, the model carries out the logic, pulls from a database and sends back a consistent response based on the controllerâ€™s instructions. v The controller then passes this data to the view to update the user interface. = When request are received, they must go to the controller before being converted into instructions for the view or model.
